p: Cinnamomum zeylanicum Blume EO interfered with the growth of C. albicans ATCC 60193 in all the tested concentrations (250 μg/mL, 500 μg/mL, and 1,000 μg/mL), inducing a significant reduction in fungal growth, as shown by the Kruskal-Wallis test followed by Dunn's post hoc test ( α = 0.05). At the MIC level, the fungus was completely eliminated after 24-h exposure to EO; at the CIMx2 and CIMx4 levels, the same effect was achieved after 8 h ( Figure 1).
